content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

I would choose R{R} in this game. Here's my reasoning:

1. The game is repeated 75 times, so the total payoff over the course of the game is more important than any single round's payoff.

2. If my opponent chooses R every time (as I do), we each get 45$ in 37.5 rounds (half of the game) and 0$ for the other 37.5 rounds, totaling 90$.

3. If my opponent chooses B every time while I choose R, I get 35$ in 37.5 rounds and nothing for the other 37.5 rounds, totaling 75$, a lower payout than option 2.

4. If my opponent chooses R half of the time (as I do), and B the other half, we each get 0$ in 18.75 rounds (a quarter of the game), 35$ in another 18.75 rounds, and 45$ in the remaining 37.5 rounds. The total payout for this scenario is 91.25$.

5. If my opponent chooses B half of the time (as I do), and R the other half, I get 0$ in 18.75 rounds (a quarter of the game), 40$ in another 18.75 rounds, and 35$ in the remaining 37.5 rounds. The total payout for this scenario is 91.25$.

6. In scenarios 4 and 5, my opponent gets a higher payout than me because I get 0$ in some rounds while they get 40$. However, these extra payouts are only received when the opponent chooses B, which reduces their average payoff per round compared to choosing R every time.

7. Comparing options 2 and 6, option 2 (choosing R every time) provides a higher total payout, so I would choose R{R}.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 35$. Please play the next round.
I choose R{R} in this round, hoping that my opponent will switch their strategy and choose R as well, maximizing both our payoffs in future rounds.
